dc_title_s: Development & Zoning Regulation Zone, Joint Base Andrews: Prince George's County, Maryland
dc_description_s: The purpose of the M-I-O Zone is to protect the public safety, health, and welfare of the citizens and residents in the County through regulation of the development and use of structures and property to promote land uses compatible with operations at Joint Base Andrews, and to protect the safety and welfare of individuals in the area of Joint Base Andrews from the potential for aircraft accidents, and the adverse impacts that are known to be associated with high levels of noises emanating from flight operations, associated with proximity to Joint Base Andrews operations; the intent of the M-I-O Zone is to protect the lives and safety of workers, visitors, and residents, while reducing interference with the military operations at Joint Base Andrews. The layer was first implemented in GIS in March of 2016 after Adoption of CR-005-2016, on January 19, 2016. The data was captured at a reference scale of 1:2400.
dc_creator_sm: The Maryland-National Capital Park & Planning Commission
